question: 顧みる
sourceMnemonic:
Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>review</kanji>. What do you do when you review something? You look back on it. Meaning <vocabulary>to look back on something</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to reflect on something</vocabulary>. This can also mean <vocabulary>to be attentive to someone</vocabulary>, for example your family.

This is a transitive verb, meaning it takes a direct object. You look back on the past, you reflect on the consequences of your actions, and you're attentive to your family.
sourceReadingMnemonic: For the reading, think about another word that is similar: <ja>帰る</ja>. With <ja>帰る</ja> you are returning to somewhere. With this word, you're returning to look back on something. They share the same first part reading, so you should take advantage of that. <ja>帰る</ja> → <ja>かえり</ja>.
